intro: Draba porsildii var. brevicula, commonly known as the short-stemmed rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent scent. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in high-altitude environments where it withstands harsh climatic conditions. Its compact growth form and hairy leaves help it conserve moisture and resist wind. Draba porsildii var. brevicula is adapted to cold climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
